title: mainnet sync hangs on 99%
body:
I'm running etherium node fisrt time and not sure is this a bug or normal 

**System information**

Geth version: v1.12.0-stable-e501b3b0
CL client & version: Prysm v4.0.5
OS & Version: Linux

**Expected behaviour**

`eth.syncing=false`

**Actual behaviour**

`eth.syncing` returns about ~100 block from head

in geth client group of logs from `Forkchoice requested sync...` to `Syncing:`
```
May 30 13:05:00 eth-mainnet geth[604]: INFO [05-30|13:05:00.417] Forkchoice requested sync to new head    number=17,371,925 hash=05f5d0..b80d6d finalized=17,371,858
May 30 13:05:06 eth-mainnet geth[604]: INFO [05-30|13:05:06.460] Syncing: chain download in progress      synced=100.00% chain=489.43GiB headers=17,371,925@7.90GiB bodies=17,371,844@334.66GiB receipts=17,371,844@146.87GiB eta=2m12.632s
May 30 13:05:07 eth-mainnet geth[604]: ERROR[05-30|13:05:07.199] Expired request does not exist           peer=ce570299e5f242edce815f035180bed32c8cddc255be51b3056d1aa63c43745d
May 30 13:05:07 eth-mainnet geth[604]: INFO [05-30|13:05:07.331] Syncing: state download in progress      synced=71.57%  state=178.94GiB accounts=159,722,481@34.67GiB slots=700,589,839@139.93GiB codes=692,373@4.34GiB eta=22m10.115s
May 30 13:05:12 eth-mainnet geth[604]: INFO [05-30|13:05:12.400] Forkchoice requested sync to new head    number=17,371,926 hash=f36eeb..6211d2 finalized=17,371,858
May 30 13:05:14 eth-mainnet geth[604]: INFO [05-30|13:05:14.478] Syncing: chain download in progress      synced=100.00% chain=489.43GiB headers=17,371,926@7.90GiB bodies=17,371,844@334.66GiB receipts=17,371,844@146.87GiB eta=2m14.555s
```

in prysm:
```
May 30 13:06:37 eth-mainnet beacon-chain[641]: time="2023-05-30 13:06:37" level=info msg="Called new payload with optimistic block" payloadBlockHash=0x6b5650bfb752 prefix=blockchain slot=6552331
May 30 13:06:37 eth-mainnet beacon-chain[641]: time="2023-05-30 13:06:37" level=info msg="Called fork choice updated with optimistic block" finalizedPayloadBlockHash=0x0a65391c7601 headPayloadBlockHash=0x6b5650bfb752 headSlot=6552331 prefix=blockchain
May 30 13:06:37 eth-mainnet beacon-chain[641]: time="2023-05-30 13:06:37" level=info msg="Synced new block" block=0xe5de62b7... epoch=204760 finalizedEpoch=204758 finalizedRoot=0xdee0094f... prefix=blockchain slot=6552331
May 30 13:06:37 eth-mainnet beacon-chain[641]: time="2023-05-30 13:06:37" level=info msg="Finished applying state transition" attestations=128 payloadHash=0x6b5650bfb752 prefix=blockchain slot=6552331 syncBitsCount=506 txCount=170
```

**Steps to reproduce the behaviour**

geth
```bash
/usr/bin/geth --cache 4096 \
   --txlookuplimit 0 \
   --http --http.addr="0.0.0.0" --http.api=eth,net,web3 --http.vhosts="*" \
   --ws --ws.addr="0.0.0.0" --ws.api=eth,net,web3 --ws.origins="*"
```

prysm
```bash
beacon-chain \
   --checkpoint-sync-url=https://sync-mainnet.beaconcha.in \
   --genesis-beacon-api-url=https://sync-mainnet.beaconcha.in \
   --execution-endpoint=/root/.ethereum/geth.ipc \
   --datadir=/root/beacon \
   --accept-terms-of-use
```

more logs with verbosity debug
```

syncing info:
```
> eth.syncing
{
  currentBlock: 17372803,
  healedBytecodeBytes: 0,
  healedBytecodes: 0,
  healedTrienodeBytes: 0,
  healedTrienodes: 0,
  healingBytecode: 0,
  healingTrienodes: 0,
  highestBlock: 17372905,
  startingBlock: 17369541,
  syncedAccountBytes: 46689203453,
  syncedAccounts: 199334306,
  syncedBytecodeBytes: 5760738183,
  syncedBytecodes: 845357,
  syncedStorage: 870211327,
  syncedStorageBytes: 186710143623
}
